column5: Anyone had any experience boarding a dog on a way to Red Lake for a week or so, in Ontario ? I took dog couple times with me ... the resort I am booking now does not take dogs ... so need to park her for few days ..

In the Dryden area, you have a choice of 2. There is the Hillcrest Animal Clinic. The link to their website is: http://www.hillcrestanimalclinic.net/. No. 2 is the Dryden Canine Academy with the link: http://www.vegakennels.com/.Be sure to take the vaccination papers along. I hope you find a place.
Thank you. Any personal experience... anyone?

I take our dogs to the Second Chance Pet place http://www.secondchancepetnetwork.ca/ Nice people. Our dogs like going there. They are located just outside of Dryden......between Hwy 502 and the mill in Dryden.
Why would you take your dogs to a non kill shelter? They do boarding as well?
Yes, they board dogs. It helps them pay the bills running the shelter. Lot's of people board their dogs there....
OK...no reports of people having theirs dogs adopted out by mistake?
You should call and talk to Anne or Trevor. There are no concerns leaving a pet with them.
